Based on the preferences you've mentioned, I would recommend "The Violent Kind" and "Lady in the Water". 

Both of these movies have intriguing plots that are sure to keep you engaged throughout. 

The first movie, "The Violent Kind", is based on a real-life event that occurred back in 1936. The story revolves around two young men who get caught up in a dangerous game of cat-and-mouse. When one of the men becomes savagely possessed and a gang of  "Rockabillies" seemingly from, you guessed it, the 1950' s descends upon them to collect what is growing inside her. 

The second movie, "Lady in the Water", is based on yet another real-life event that occurred back in 1872. The story revolves around a young woman named Elizabeth Stowe who sets out to sue a wealthy businessman named Roger Wilkins for the death of one of his employees. When Elizabeth manages to track down Roger and win the case, she becomes a household name and goes on to become a prominent political figure in the years that followed.
